intro: Ardisia morazanensis, commonly known as the Morazanite beauty, is a small evergreen shrub native to Central America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees adapted to acidic soils. The plant features glossy, elliptical leaves that are typically dark green in color. It produces small, white flowers followed by bright red berries that are attractive to birds. Ardisia morazanensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in shaded garden environments.
